questions.question: True or False: Delegates decided to scrap the Articles of Confederation and develop a new form of government.
. True or False: Large and Small states argued over how their states should be represented.
True or False: The Virginia Plan favored large states and would give a state a number of delegates/votes based on their
True or False: The New Jersey Plan favored the small states and gave votes/delegates regardless of the population.
True or False: The Great Compromise created two houses in the Congress. The House of Representatives and Senate.
Multiple Choice: Which of the following was a reason the Anti-Federalists did not want to ratify the Constitution.

choices.answer: Theywanted a Bill of Rights to be outlined in the Constitution.
Believed a stronger central government was needed.
Didnot believe the United States would last under the Articles of Confederation.
Hadto curb the power of the states.

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason the Federalists wanted to ratify the Constitution.

choices.answer: Theywanted to include a Bill of Rights
They wanted to keep the Union small.

questions.question: Multiple Choice: Which of the following was NOT a power denied to the Government under the Articles of Confederation.

choices.answer: A.Power to declare war and make peace.
B.Power to raise funds for an army or navy.
C.Power to control trade among the states.
D.Power to tax, collect tariffs or duties.

questions.question: Multiple Choice: Under the Articles of Confederation which of the following was an issue facing the country.
True or False: Under the Articles of Confederation states would keep their sovereignty(control.)
True or False: The Founders were fearful of concentrated power due to their experience with Great Britain.
True or False: Bills were passed on 7 out of 13 votes.
True or False: Each state had one vote regardless of population size.
True or False: Congress had the power to requisition(claim) money.
